summary:
The Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC/Radio-Canada) is Canada's public broadcaster for radio and TV. It's like a big, old radio and TV station that the government owns. It started in 1936 and has lots of channels in English and French. CBC runs radio stations like CBC Radio One and Ici Radio-Canada Première, and TV channels like CBC Television and Ici Radio-Canada Télé. They also have news and other shows on cable.

CBC broadcasts in many languages, but due to money problems, they've cut back on some services. They make money from ads on TV and used to have them on the radio, but not anymore.
title: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
